name: LoadJob
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
description:
LoadJob

A Job subclass representing a load operation that may be performed on a Table. A LoadJob instance is created when you call Table#load_job.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"

gs_url = "gs://my-bucket/file-name.csv"
load_job = dataset.load_job "my_new_table", gs_url do |schema|
  schema.string "first_name", mode: :required
  schema.record "cities_lived", mode: :repeated do |nested_schema|
    nested_schema.string "place", mode: :required
    nested_schema.integer "number_of_years", mode: :required
  end
end

load_job.wait_until_done!
load_job.done? #=> true

methods.name: sources
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#sources
methods.description: The URI or URIs representing the Google Cloud Storage files from which the operation loads data.

methods.name: destination
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#destination
methods.description: The table into which the operation loads data. This is the table on which Table#load_job was invoked.

returns.description: A table instance.

methods.name: delimiter
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#delimiter
methods.description: The delimiter used between fields in the source data. The default is a comma (,).

returns.description: A string containing the character, such as ",".

methods.name: skip_leading_rows
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#skip_leading_rows
methods.description: The number of rows at the top of a CSV file that BigQuery will skip when loading the data. The default value is 0. This property is useful if you have header rows in the file that should be skipped.

returns.description:
The number of header rows at the top of a CSV file
to skip.

methods.name: utf8?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#utf8?
methods.description: Checks if the character encoding of the data is UTF-8. This is the default.

returns.description: true when the character encoding is UTF-8, false otherwise.

methods.name: iso8859_1?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#iso8859_1?
methods.description: Checks if the character encoding of the data is ISO-8859-1.

returns.description: true when the character encoding is ISO-8859-1, false otherwise.

methods.name: quote
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#quote
methods.description: The value that is used to quote data sections in a CSV file. The default value is a double-quote ("). If your data does not contain quoted sections, the value should be an empty string. If your data contains quoted newline characters, #quoted_newlines? should return true.

returns.description: A string containing the character, such as "\"".

methods.name: max_bad_records
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#max_bad_records
methods.description: The maximum number of bad records that the load operation can ignore. If the number of bad records exceeds this value, an error is returned. The default value is 0, which requires that all records be valid.

returns.description: The maximum number of bad records.

methods.name: null_marker
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#null_marker
methods.description: Specifies a string that represents a null value in a CSV file. For example, if you specify \N, BigQuery interprets \N as a null value when loading a CSV file. The default value is the empty string. If you set this property to a custom value, BigQuery throws an error if an empty string is present for all data types except for STRING and BYTE. For STRING and BYTE columns, BigQuery interprets the empty string as an empty value.

returns.description: A string representing null value in a CSV file.

methods.name: quoted_newlines?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#quoted_newlines?
methods.description: Checks if quoted data sections may contain newline characters in a CSV file. The default is false.

returns.description: true when quoted newlines are allowed, false otherwise.

methods.name: autodetect?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#autodetect?
methods.description: Checks if BigQuery should automatically infer the options and schema for CSV and JSON sources. The default is false.

returns.description: true when autodetect is enabled, false otherwise.

methods.name: json?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#json?
methods.description: Checks if the format of the source data is newline-delimited JSON. The default is false.

returns.description: true when the source format is NEWLINE_DELIMITED_JSON, false otherwise.

methods.name: csv?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#csv?
methods.description: Checks if the format of the source data is CSV. The default is true.

returns.description: true when the source format is CSV, false otherwise.

methods.name: backup?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#backup?
methods.description: Checks if the source data is a Google Cloud Datastore backup.

returns.description: true when the source format is DATASTORE_BACKUP, false otherwise.

methods.name: allow_jagged_rows?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#allow_jagged_rows?
methods.description: Checks if the load operation accepts rows that are missing trailing optional columns. The missing values are treated as nulls. If false, records with missing trailing columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an error is returned. The default value is false. Only applicable to CSV, ignored for other formats.

returns.description: true when jagged rows are allowed, false otherwise.

methods.name: ignore_unknown_values?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#ignore_unknown_values?
methods.description: Checks if the load operation allows extra values that are not represented in the table schema. If true, the extra values are ignored. If false, records with extra columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an invalid error is returned. The default is false.

returns.description: true when unknown values are ignored, false otherwise.

methods.name: schema
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#schema
methods.description:
The schema for the destination table. The schema can be omitted if the destination table already exists, or if you’re loading data from Google Cloud Datastore.

The returned object is frozen and changes are not allowed. Use Table#schema to update the schema.

returns.description: A schema object, or nil.

methods.name: input_files
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#input_files
methods.description: The number of source data files in the load job.

returns.description: The number of source files.

methods.name: input_file_bytes
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#input_file_bytes
methods.description: The number of bytes of source data in the load job.

returns.description: The number of bytes.

methods.name: output_rows
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#output_rows
methods.description: The number of rows that have been loaded into the table. While an import job is in the running state, this value may change.

returns.description: The number of rows that have been loaded.

methods.name: output_bytes
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#output_bytes
methods.description: The number of bytes that have been loaded into the table. While an import job is in the running state, this value may change.

returns.description: The number of bytes that have been loaded.
